text: I really believe X as a service is
equivalent to the oil boom this is a
time right now that there's so much
opportunity in the industry and AWS
makes the American dream possible with
regard to technology implementation my
name is Chris chenone I'm the Chief
Information officer for the city of
mckin Texas mckin is a really dynamic
city we just got ranked number one in
the country to live in 2014 we're about
15 Mi north of Dallas so we're right
next it's a small town called Frisco
kind of nestled between a lot of the
other cities that are kind of landlocked
which mckin has the opportunity to grow
I do believe the last projections were
somewhere around 350,000 people money is
always the you know the backbone to all
issues that uh the organizations face so
what we wanted to do is move to a model
where we could deliver more to our
citizens and to reduce the cost of
delivering those services to them we
chose AWS cuz we looked around at
several different areas and I'm a one
throat to choke one back to back time of
a person so I wanted to put everything
into a product line that has the ability
to scale it has the ability to grow that
has the ability to grow with my my
department so AWS was a really really uh
easy fit for us for the way we do
business the products that we're running
on AWS are what I call consider the
foundational products which would be ec2
and S3 we also are using like elastic
cache we are using using load balancing
we're using uh Lambda in our development
environment we're looking at elastic
beant stock and some of the other things
that we're doing um we're using a whole
entire um range of AWS products in
addition to we're using other products
that we use on our infrastructure as
well in a virtualized environment so it
makes that first phase of our Evolution
to be a lot more natural a lot more
comfortable for the first phase of the
migration into AWS the benefits are are
astronomical I mean not only on the
capex Opex side but then I don't have to
worry about device drivers and all the
other things that come along with it
basically I get to worry about how do I
take a business need find software that
actually augments that business need and
then make it a deliverable so people
could actually uh do the work that they
need to do owning an infrastructure and
O is as silly as owning your own power
plant you know just because we consume
energy we don't need to uh own the the
vehicle to deliver that energy so by us
using AWS it gives us the ability to use
the resources that are available for us
to do work but not own those
infrastructures to deliver that work
product going Allin uh at a city of our
size means that I could do more with
less so as uh constituents want more and
more services the cost goes up but yet
there's that driving pressure to reduce
taxes and fees so the really the only
way to shift in my opinion money around
in an organization is to move from capex
to Opex and that does does is frees up
some more money in my opinion that we
could give back to the organization
maybe it could be a fir truck maybe it's
a bridge maybe it's a sidewalk but it's
something along those lines where if I
could do more with less I could return
some of those funds back to areas that
needed more
